text: Ngunnawal or Gundungurra is an extant Australian Aboriginal language, the traditional language of the Ngunnawal and Gandangara peoples. There are contradictory claims as to whether they are one language or two. The name Burragorang is applied to either. ==Classification== Gundungurra/Ngunawal is generally classified to fall within the tentative (and perhaps geographic) Yuin–Kuric group of the Pama–Nyungan family. ==Sounds== {| class="IPA wikitable" |- |+Ngunnawal consonants | !
